other_tests.procedure_name: Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) of the head
other_tests.findings: Extensive periventricular gray-matter heterotopia, a large cisterna magna, and micrognathia; no evidence of intracranial venous thrombosis.

Patent foramen ovale, a large perimembranous ventricular septal defect, an effective small left-to-right shunt, a competent bicuspid aortic valve with trivial stenosis and aortic dilatation, a large patent ductus arteriosus with bidirectional flow, and preserved biventricular function.
Pulmonary arterial pressure of 51/23 mm Hg, aortic pressure of 53/24 mm Hg, and no substantial change in pulmonary artery pressure after ductus closure.
other_tests.changes_over_time: After ductus closure, pulmonary arterial pressure measured at 58/19 mm Hg; no significant change noted.

other_tests.findings: Pulmonary arterial pressure decreased to 28/10 mm Hg under supplemental oxygen and 27/9 mm Hg with inhaled nitric oxide.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Pulmonary arterial pressure before oxygen treatment was higher at 36/12 mm Hg.

other_tests.findings: Histopathological examination revealed areas of normal cellularity alternating with areas of abnormally high cellularity, and interstitial thickening caused by proliferation of capillaries.
Normal sinus rhythm at a rate of 153 beats per minute, normal for the patient's age.
Heterozygous disease-causing mutation in FLNA (c.6577delC; p.Arg2193AlafsX14) predicted to cause a loss of function.
